intro: Ceropegia ceratophora, commonly known as the horned ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that resemble horns, hence its common name. The plant typically grows as a succulent with fleshy, trailing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces showy, often colorful flowers that attract specific pollinators, such as certain moths. Ceropegia ceratophora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
